intro: Elytranthe subumbellata, commonly known as the small umbellate elytranthe, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
